column1: In 1535–1571 the town was the seat of John of Brandenburg-Küstrin

column6: Küstrin was occupied by a French military garrison for the remainder of the Napoleonic Wars. During the French retreat from the east in 1814
column7: the town was set on fire and burnt to the ground. The town recovered and became one of the most important railway hubs in the Kingdom of Prussia and later the German Empire.
